H0.text: A mixture is the type of substance formed when chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal.

H1.text: A compound is the type of substance formed when chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal.

H2.text: An element is the type of substance formed when chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal.

H3.text: An alloy is the type of substance formed when chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal.

H4.text: A solution is the type of substance formed when chlorine gas reacts with sodium metal.

A5.text: Sodium chloride, commonly known as table salt, is an ionic compound with the chemical formula NaCl, representing a 1:1 ratio of sodium and chloride ions.

A6.text: Common salt has a 1:1 molar ratio of sodium and chlorine.
